item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I ate them like salad, books were my sandwich for lunch, my tiffin and dinner and midnight munch. I tore out the pages, ate them with salt, doused them with relish, gnawed on the bindings, turned the chapters with my tongue! Books by the dozen, the score and the billion. I carried so many home I was hunchbacked for years. Philosophy, art history, politics, social science, the poem, the essay, the grandiose play, you name 'em, I ate 'em." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Do you know that books smell like nutmeg or some spice from a foreign land? I loved to smell them when I was a boy. Lord, there were a lot of lovely books once, before we let them go." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "Never say anything that doesn't improve on silence." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Vangelicmonk add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Nothing makes the earth seem so spacious as to have friends at a distance; they make the latitudes and longitudes." -- Henry David Thoreau
